definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
obstructed/to fail/to oppress/to repress/to lower the tone/to bend back/to dampen

sentences.english: Sometimes she frustrates me in the same way my mom frustrates me.
sentences.chinese: 有時她會像我媽媽對待我那樣讓我受挫。

sentences.english: When romantic love is thwarted, the lover just love harder.
sentences.chinese: 當戀愛受挫，那些人只是愛得更加沉重。

sentences.english: I feel disconcerted each time I see him behave in such a childish manner.
sentences.chinese: 每次看到他舉止如此幼稚我都會感到很受挫。

sentences.english: Frustrations and limitations could cause anxiety this week.
sentences.chinese: 本週你可能會受挫，受限制，而感到焦慮。

sentences.english: The resulting conflicts in policy, and the continual changing of plans, soon demoralized the department.
sentences.chinese: 決策上的衝突，計劃的不斷變更很快使部門士氣受挫。

sentences.english: The high wall mocked his hopes of escaping .
sentences.chinese: 那高圍牆使他逃跑的希受挫。

sentences.english: Ask him to transform your discouragement into patience.
sentences.chinese: 請求祂將你的受挫化爲耐心。

sentences.english: Read about the return of some confidence to battered markets.
sentences.chinese: 詳情請見關於受挫市場信心迴歸的報道。

sentences.english: Find DongWang DuoCi son of, but time frustration.
sentences.chinese: 欣兒多次找到董旺，卻一次次受挫。

sentences.english: To develop students' reasonable abilities to recover from frustrations and grasp the activity of frustrations.
sentences.chinese: 培養學生受挫後的恢復力，把握挫折的能動性。

sentences.english: He admits, however, that insurance difficulties might scupper that idea.
sentences.chinese: 不過他承認安全困難可能使計劃受挫。

sentences.english: The thwarting of those hopes has led to widespread anger.
sentences.chinese: 這些希望受挫，造成了廣泛的憤怒。

sentences.english: Thus his troops are not worn out and his victories are complete.
sentences.chinese: 這樣一來軍隊不會疲憊，士氣受挫，而能取得全勝。

sentences.english: Much of Americans' frustration concerns the nation's stubborn 10-percent unemployment rate.
sentences.chinese: 很多美國人的受挫感來自高達10%的沉重的失業率。

sentences.english: They are, I think, not so disappointed, or not so frustrated.
sentences.chinese: 他們，我認爲，並未失望，或者說並未受挫。

sentences.english: The third task is to restore battered morale while simultaneously boosting productivity.
sentences.chinese: 第三個問題是在提高公司效率的同時重振受挫的士氣。

definition: to thwart/to foil (sb's plans)/a setback/a failure/a defeat
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
setback/reverse/check/defeat/frustration/disappointment/to frustrate/to discourage/to set sb back/to blunt/to subdue
to hit a wall/(fig.) to hit a brick wall/to hit a snag/to have the door slammed in one's face
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
devastating setback/slump (in stock market etc)/crushing defeat/to cause a serious setback/to plummet
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
to be defeated/to lose/to fail (e.g. experiments)/failure/defeat/CL:次[ci4]
